perturbation.original_text: 2.9 Parties acknowledge that the Dutch telecommunications market is regulated under both Dutch and EU law, such as inter alia EU-directives, the Dutch Telecommunications Act, Dutch Competition Act and the Dutch Data Protection Act. Parties shall at all times fully comply with all relevant regulations, such as but not limited to, the obligation for ELEPHANT TALK - as providers of public electronic communications services in the Netherlands- to notify OPTA according to article 2.1 of the Dutch Telecommunication Act.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.9 Parties acknowledge that the Dutch telecommunications market is regulated under both Dutch and EU law, such as inter alia EU-directives, the Dutch Telecommunications Act, Dutch Competition Act and the Dutch Data Protection Act. Parties shall endeavor to comply with relevant regulations, such as but not limited to, the obligation for ELEPHANT TALK - as providers of public electronic communications services in the Netherlands- to notify OPTA according to article 2.1 of the Dutch Telecommunication Act.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall at all times fully comply' to 'shall endeavor to comply' introduces ambiguity. While the original text mandated strict adherence to regulations, the modified text suggests that compliance is subject to effort, potentially falling short of full compliance. This contradicts the strict regulatory requirements of Dutch and EU telecommunications law, which often require mandatory and verifiable compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Dutch Telecommunications Act, EU directives on telecommunications

perturbation.original_text: 7.2 Both Parties confirm that they shall comply with the Data Privacy regulations and laws applicable in the Netherlands and internationally, including the Dutch Data Protection Act ("Wet Bescherming Persoonsgegevens"), as amended or varied from time to time. T-Mobile undertakes to process personal data only for the purpose of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.2 Both Parties acknowledge their intent to adhere to Data Privacy regulations and laws applicable in the Netherlands and internationally, including the Dutch Data Protection Act ("Wet Bescherming Persoonsgegevens"), as amended or varied from time to time. T-Mobile will attempt to process personal data only for the purpose of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall comply' with 'acknowledge their intent to adhere' and 'undertakes to process' with 'will attempt to process' weakens the legally binding nature of data privacy obligations. Data protection laws such as the Dutch Data Protection Act require strict compliance. Introducing 'intent' and 'attempt' makes compliance discretionary rather than mandatory, potentially violating these laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Dutch Data Protection Act (Wet Bescherming Persoonsgegevens), GDPR (as it applies to international data transfers)

perturbation.original_text: 15.4 ELEPHANT TALK will defend, indemnify and will hold T-Mobile harmless from and against any claim and costs assessed against T- Mobile by a third party alleging that the ELEPHANT TALK Wholesale Services, constitute an infringement of any third party's intellectual property rights in circumstances where the alleged infringement is attributable to ELEPHANT TALK and in no way the fault of T-Mobile or its Affiliated Company. If such a claim is valid, ELEPHANT TALK shall make the modifications needed to cease the infringement at its own expense as soon as possible. Such modifications will not have any impact on the functionality and costs of the provided Hosting Services. ELEPHANT TALK shall inform T-Mobile on any of such modifications as soon as possible.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.4 ELEPHANT TALK will endeavor to defend, indemnify and hold T-Mobile harmless from claims by a third party alleging intellectual property infringement related to the ELEPHANT TALK Wholesale Services, provided that the infringement is directly attributable to ELEPHANT TALK. If a claim appears valid, ELEPHANT TALK will consider making modifications to cease the infringement. ELEPHANT TALK will inform T-Mobile of any such considerations when practical.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the obligation to defend and indemnify T-Mobile against IP infringement claims. Replacing 'will defend, indemnify and will hold harmless' with 'will endeavor to defend, indemnify and hold harmless' makes the obligation less certain. Also 'shall make the modifications needed to cease the infringement at its own expense as soon as possible' becomes 'will consider making modifications to cease the infringement', which is vague. These changes make the protection of T-Mobile's interests against IP claims less certain and enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law in the Netherlands (Auteurswet), EU Directives on Intellectual Property Rights
